intro: Corydalis solida, commonly known as the solid corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant features slender, branching stems and trifoliate leaves, which are composed of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. Corydalis solida is often found in rocky or woodland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and shady borders.
